title: Hydration and Health: How Much Water Should You Really Drink Daily?
summary: Discover the science behind daily water intake and how much hydration your body truly needs.
author: Hippie and Healthy

content.text: Water is essential for life, but how much should you really drink each day? While the '8 glasses a day' rule is popular, actual needs vary based on age, activity level, and environment.
Staying properly hydrated supports digestion, circulation, and cognitive function. Dehydration can lead to fatigue, headaches, and reduced performance.
Experts recommend drinking water when thirsty and adjusting intake based on climate, exercise, and diet. Foods like fruits and vegetables also contribute to daily hydration.
"Listen to your body â€“ thirst is your best hydration guide."
For most adults, the National Academies of Sciences suggests about 3.7 liters for men and 2.7 liters for women per day, including fluids from all sources.

items: Drink a glass of water before meals
Eat water-rich foods like cucumbers and oranges
Set reminders to drink water throughout the day
